alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Bedford; City of Lynchburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Minor flood threat continue for the Lynchburg area and vicinity... ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from earlier heavy rainfall and lingering rainfall is expected or is already occurring. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in central Virginia, Amherst and City of Lynchburg. In south central Virginia, Bedford. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM EDT, Heavy rain fell along and near the U.S. 460 corridor from Bedford to Lynchburg and vicinity during the past couple of hours. Rainfall was diminishing at this time within the advisory area. Earlier, broadcast media reported issues with overflowing poor drainage areas causing minor flooding in parts of Lynchburg City. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain fell in the vicinity between 3 pm and 4 pm. Additional light to moderate rainfall remains possible during the next hour or so. Up to 1/2 inch of additional rainfall is possible. - Lynchburg City and east Bedford county are the most likely areas to experience minor flooding. This includes the following streams and drainages... Blackwater Creek, Burton Creek, Elk Creek, Dreaming Creek, Big Otter River and Buffalo Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Lynchburg... Bedford... Forest... Timberlake... Goode... Madison Heights... - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
